alert.note: Alert for Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 8:58PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherry and southeastern Sheridan Counties through 845 PM MDT... At 757 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 23 miles south of Rushville, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Watson Lake, Kennedy Lake, Smith Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Wolf Hill and Argo Hill. This includes Highway 250 between mile markers 21 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
